ai.summary: Green Link Walk (Section 2) is a 16.2 km hard hike in the UK (region not specified). The route challenges experienced hikers with a long distance and varied terrain; expect changes in elevation, rough sections, and weather. Plan for a full day or longer.
ai.terrain_summary: The route traverses undulating countryside with mixed surfaces: tarmac, gravel, muddy trails, and occasional rocky sections. Expect gates, stiles, and potentially waterlogged paths after rain. Footing can be slippery in wet conditions, and longer sections may have exposed or open ground.
ai.safety_notes: - Weather can change rapidly in the UK; always check the forecast and carry waterproofs. - The length and hardness require good fitness; start early and be mindful of daylight. - Carry a map and compass or a reliable GPS; do not rely solely on phone signals. - Bring enough water and high-energy snacks; consider electrolytes. - Wear sturdy boots; use gaiters in muddy conditions. - Pack a first aid kit, basic tools, and a whistle for emergencies. - Inform someone of your plans and expected return. - If conditions are icy or stormy, consider postponing or turning back.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support and grip
Weather-appropriate layers, including a waterproof outer shell
Backpack with water capacity (2–3 L) and space for essentials
Food and hydration (water or electrolyte drinks)
Map and compass, or a GPS device; ensure devices are charged
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
First aid kit and emergency whistle
Walking poles (optional but helpful on uneven sections)
Dry bag or waterproof cover for electronics and valuables
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) recommended for milder weather and longer daylight; winter hikes are possible but require advanced planning and skills.

seo.title: Green Link Walk (Section 2) – 16.2 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Guide to Green Link Walk Section 2: a demanding 16.2 km hike in the UK. Learn terrain, safety tips, gear list, and the best seasons for this challenging route.
